title: Rear Brake Caliper - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Inspect the condition of the sliding pin seal, see
Position the caliper and carrier assembly to the swinging arm as noted for removal. Align the slot on the carrier with the boss on the swinging arm.
Connect the brake hose to the caliper incorporating new washers on each side of the union bolt.
Position the wheel speed sensor to the caliper carrier.
Fit and tighten the fixing to
Route the wheel speed sensor harness through the cover for the bleed screw and close the cover to retain the lead.
Rear ABS wheel speed sensor fixing
Use only DOT 4 specification brake fluid.
The use of brake fluids other than those DOT 4 fluids may reduce the efficiency of the braking system.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Fill the master cylinder with new, DOT 4 brake fluid from a sealed container, see
It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes.
The fault must be checked and rectified by a competent person with the specialist knowledge and technical understanding of motorcycles, such as an authorised Triumph dealer.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Check for correct brake operation. Rectify as necessary.
